verses.verse: And when Balaam <S%H1109><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that it pleased <S%H5869><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> to bless <S%H1288><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%>, he went <S%H1980><s%> not <S%H6471><s%>, as at other times, to seek <S%H7125><s%> for enchantments <S%H5173><s%>, but he set <S%H7896><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%> toward the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>.

And Balaam <S%H1109><s%> lifted up <S%H5375><s%> his eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and he saw <S%H7200><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> abiding <S%H7931><s%> in his tents according to their tribes <S%H7626><s%>; and the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of God came upon him <S%H430><s%>.

And he took up <S%H5375><s%> his parable <S%H4912><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Balaam <S%H1109><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Beor <S%H1160><s%> has said <S%H5002><s%>, and the man <S%H1397><s%> whose eyes <S%H5869><s%> are open <S%H8365><s%> has said <S%H5002><s%>:

He has said <S%H5002><s%>, which heard <S%H8085><s%> the words <S%H561><s%> of God <S%H410><s%>, which saw <S%H2372><s%> the vision <S%H4236><s%> of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>, falling <S%H5307><s%> into a trance <S%H5869><s%>, but having his eyes open <S%H1540><s%>:
How good <S%H2895><s%> are your tents <S%H168><s%>, O Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, and your tabernacles <S%H4908><s%>, O Israel <S%H3478><s%>!

As the valleys <S%H5158><s%> are they spread forth <S%H5186><s%>, as gardens <S%H1593><s%> by the river <S%H5104><s%>'s side, as the trees of lign <S%H174><s%> - aloes which the Lord <S%H3068><s%> has planted <S%H5193><s%>, and as cedar trees <S%H730><s%> beside the waters <S%H4325><s%>.

He shall pour <S%H5140><s%> the water <S%H4325><s%> out <S%H5140><s%> of his buckets <S%H1805><s%>, and his seed <S%H2233><s%> shall be in many <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>, and his king <S%H4428><s%> shall be higher <S%H7311><s%> than Agag <S%H90><s%>, and his kingdom <S%H4438><s%> shall be exalted <S%H5375><s%>.

God <S%H410><s%> brought him forth <S%H3318><s%> out of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>; he has as it were the strength <S%H8443><s%> of an unicorn <S%H7214><s%>: he shall eat up <S%H398><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%> his enemies <S%H6862><s%>, and shall break <S%H1633><s%> their bones <S%H6106><s%>, and pierce <S%H4272><s%> them through with his arrows <S%H2671><s%>.

He couched <S%H3766><s%>, he lay down <S%H7901><s%> as a lion <S%H738><s%>, and as a great lion <S%H3833><s%>: who shall stir him up <S%H6965><s%>? Blessed <S%H1288><s%> is he that blesses <S%H1288><s%> you <S%H779><s%>, and cursed is he that curses you <S%H779><s%>.

And Balak <S%H1111><s%>'s anger <S%H639><s%> was kindled <S%H2734><s%> against Balaam <S%H1109><s%>, and he struck <S%H5606><s%> his hands <S%H3709><s%> together <S%H5606><s%>: and Balak <S%H1111><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Balaam <S%H1109><s%>, I called <S%H7121><s%> you to curse <S%H6895><s%> my enemies <S%H341><s%>, and <S%H1288><s%>, behold, you have altogether blessed <S%H1288><s%> them these three <S%H7969><s%> times <S%H6471><s%>.

Therefore now flee <S%H1272><s%> you to your place <S%H4725><s%>: I thought <S%H559><s%> to promote <S%H3513><s%> you unto great <S%H3513><s%> honor <S%H3513><s%>; but <S%H3068><s%>, behold, the Lord has kept you back <S%H4513><s%> from honor <S%H3519><s%>.
And Balaam <S%H1109><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Balak <S%H1111><s%>, Spoke <S%H1696><s%> I not also to your messengers <S%H4397><s%> which you sent <S%H7971><s%> unto me <S%H559><s%>, saying,

If Balak <S%H1111><s%> would give <S%H5414><s%> me his house <S%H1004><s%> full <S%H4393><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold <S%H2091><s%>, I cannot <S%H3201><s%> go beyond <S%H5674><s%> the commandment <S%H6310><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, to do <S%H6213><s%> either good <S%H2896><s%> or bad <S%H7451><s%> of my own mind <S%H3820><s%>; but what the Lord <S%H3068><s%> says <S%H1696><s%>, that will I speak <S%H1696><s%>?

And now <S%H1980><s%>, behold, I go unto my people <S%H5971><s%>: come <S%H3212><s%> therefore <S%H3289><s%>, and I will advertise you what this people <S%H5971><s%> shall do <S%H6213><s%> to your people <S%H5971><s%> in the latter <S%H319><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>.

And he took up <S%H5375><s%> his parable <S%H4912><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Balaam <S%H1109><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Beor <S%H1160><s%> has said <S%H5002><s%>, and the man <S%H1397><s%> whose eyes <S%H5869><s%> are open <S%H8365><s%> has said <S%H5002><s%>:

He has said <S%H5002><s%>, which heard <S%H8085><s%> the words <S%H561><s%> of God <S%H410><s%>, and knew <S%H3045><s%> the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of the most High <S%H5945><s%>, which saw <S%H2372><s%> the vision <S%H4236><s%> of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>, falling <S%H5307><s%> into a trance <S%H5869><s%>, but having his eyes open <S%H1540><s%>:

I shall see <S%H7200><s%> him <S%H7789><s%>, but not now: I shall behold him <S%H7138><s%>, but not near: there shall come <S%H1869><s%> a Star <S%H3556><s%> out of Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, and a Sceptre <S%H7626><s%> shall rise <S%H6965><s%> out of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and shall strike <S%H4272><s%> the corners <S%H6285><s%> of Moab <S%H4124><s%>, and destroy <S%H6979><s%> all the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Sheth <S%H8352><s%>.

And Edom <S%H123><s%> shall be a possession <S%H3424><s%>, Seir <S%H8165><s%> also shall be a possession <S%H3424><s%> for his enemies <S%H341><s%>; and Israel <S%H3478><s%> shall do <S%H6213><s%> valiantly <S%H2428><s%>.
Out of Jacob <S%H3290><s%> shall come he that shall have dominion <S%H7287><s%>, and shall destroy <S%H6><s%> him that remains <S%H8300><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%>.

And when he looked <S%H7200><s%> on Amalek <S%H6002><s%>, he took up <S%H5375><s%> his parable <S%H4912><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Amalek <S%H6002><s%> was the first <S%H7225><s%> of the nations <S%H1471><s%>; but his latter <S%H319><s%> end shall be that he perish <S%H8><s%> for ever <S%H5703><s%>.

And he looked <S%H7200><s%> on the Kenites <S%H7017><s%>, and took up <S%H5375><s%> his parable <S%H4912><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Strong <S%H386><s%> is your dwellingplace <S%H4186><s%>, and you set <S%H7760><s%> your nest <S%H7064><s%> in a rock <S%H5553><s%>.
Nevertheless the Kenite <S%H7014><s%> shall <S%H518><s%> be wasted <S%H1197><s%>, until Asshur <S%H804><s%> shall carry you away captive <S%H7617><s%>.
And he took up <S%H5375><s%> his parable <S%H4912><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Alas <S%H188><s%>, who shall live <S%H2421><s%> when God <S%H410><s%> does this <S%H7760><s%>!

And ships <S%H6716><s%> shall come from the coast <S%H3027><s%> of Chittim <S%H3794><s%>, and shall afflict <S%H6031><s%> Asshur <S%H804><s%>, and shall afflict <S%H6031><s%> Eber <S%H5677><s%>, and he also shall perish <S%H8><s%> for ever <S%H5703><s%>.
And Balaam <S%H1109><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%>, and went <S%H3212><s%> and returned <S%H7725><s%> to his place <S%H4725><s%>: and Balak <S%H1111><s%> also went <S%H1980><s%> his way <S%H1870><s%>.
